Bluetooth.summary: NOTE Experimental The Bluetooth interface of the Web Bluetooth API provides methods to query Bluetooth availability and request access to devices.

BluetoothGetDevices.summary: NOTE Experimental The getDevices() method of the interface returns an array containing the Bluetooth devices that this origin is allowed to access â€” including those that are out of range and powered off.
BluetoothGetDevices.returns: A {{JSxRef("Promise")}} that resolves with an array of objects.

BluetoothGetAvailability.summary: NOTE Experimental The getAvailability() method of the interface nominally returns true if the user agent can support Bluetooth (because the device has a Bluetooth adapter), and false otherwise.

remarks.para:
The word "nominally" is used because if permission to use the Web Bluetooth API is disallowed by the Permissions-Policy: bluetooth permission, the method will always return false.
In addition, a user can configure their browser to return false from a getAvailability() call even if the browser does have an operational Bluetooth adapter, and vice versa. This setting value ignored if access is blocked by the permission.

Even if getAvailability() returns true and the device actually has a Bluetooth adaptor, this does not necessarily mean that calling will resolve with a .
The Bluetooth adapter may not be powered, and a user might deny permission to use the API when prompted.

BluetoothGetAvailability.returns:
A that resolves with a .The will resolve with a value of false if access is disallowed by Permissions-Policy: bluetooth, if the user has configured the browser to always resolve with false, or if the device does not have a Bluetooth adapter.
Otherwise it will resolve with true.

BluetoothRequestDevice.summary:
NOTE Experimental The Bluetooth.requestDevice() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that fulfills with a object matching the specified options.
If there is no chooser UI, this method returns the first device matching the criteria.

remarks.para: -Communicating with Bluetooth devices over JavaScript on developer.chrome.com.
